rules: The audience is requested to maintain silence throughout the event.
There should be no shouting or howling at any time of the event.
If you know the answer, please do not shout out or attempt to give hints to the participants.
Feel free to applaud and encourage the teams after each round, but wait until the round is over.
The participants are requested not to go for any unfair means, if caught there will be an instant disqualification.
If a question is unclear, ask immediately. No clarifications will be given once the timer begins.
There will be 8 questions in total, 2 for each team.
30 points will be awarded for every correct answer.
30 points will be deducted for every wrong answer and not attempting a question.
There is no passing in this round.
30 seconds will be given for answering each question.
Each team will be asked 10 questions.
10 points will be awarded for every correct answer.
5 points will be deducted for every wrong answer.
If you do not know the answer to any question, you can pass the question, but 5 marks will be deducted for not attempting the question.
You will have 60 seconds to answer all the questions.
There will be 8 questions in total.
aisnawknj
There will be 12 questions in total, 2 for each team
10 points will be awarded for every correct answer.
There is no negative marking in this round.
Questions can be passed, the team answering a passed question will be awarded 5 points.
If none of the teams are able to answer a question, it will be passed to the audience, who will be awarded a +5 for a correct answer as well.
There are no eliminations in this round.
25 seconds will be given to answer each question.
There will be 12 questions in total, 2 for each team.
20 points will be awarded for every correct answer.
10 points will be deducted for every wrong answer or for not attempting a question.
The questions cannot be passed.
The team with the lowest score will be eliminated.
15 seconds will be given to answer each question.

Quest_round1.quest: What is the term for a unique identifier assigned to a network interface for communications on the physical network segment?

Which company developed the first graphical web browser, called Mosaic?
What is the term for the main directory of a file system?
What does "MIME" stand for in email technology?
What is the process called when a computer reboots without completely turning off the power?
What does "P2P" stand for in networking?
What is the term for a network device that amplifies and retransmits signals?

Quest_round2.option3: The process of analyzing data to find patterns
